author: Katie McHugh
comment: UPDATE: Now it looks like it's hacking. I've NEVER instigated sleep record but I got a notification this afternoon asking if I slept between (time X) and (time Y) and wanting me to create a sleep record!!?? Pressing Cancel did hide this but it did not get rid of it. And Devs, please don't respond with your generic BS Auto-response, it just proves how useless you are. PREVIOUS: This app is supposed to be able to sound the alarm even when the Do Not Disturb function is active on the phone. It does  not. In the app I have everything checked to enable it to override the Do Not Disturb function and on my phone, from the Settings menu I have allowed this app to override the Do Not Disturb function but still not a single sound.

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: UPDATE: just use the never action on that notification and you won't see "Sleep time suggestions" any more. For details please contact: support@urbandroid.org or to give us more details, use menu-report a bug. Many thanks. Jiri from Urbandroid Team.

author: Michael Cooperman
comment: Great app.  my sleep has improved. Easy to use. It replaced Ambio app and an alarm program I had on my phone.  Worth the money, a Great investment for anyone with trouble sleeping. Alarm wakes you close to desired time. Reason being it does so when you're in the lightest stage of sleep instead of rem. This way you don't wake up feeling groggy. Alarm starts quietly and builds so you're not startled. You can use your own sounds for the alarm as well.

author: Cameron Greenfield
comment: Been using this app since my very first smartphone. Works brilliantly! One thing I can't figure out is how the Smart Period works. I set it to the default 30 minutes but, I'm always woken up 30 mins. early every time! Never on time. Being up early is fine and dandy but, sometimes I wish it'd let me sleep a proper 8 hrs., not 7 1/2!

author: Mark Berquist
comment: I have been using this app for years.  The smart period wake up feature and the crescendo/vibration alarm soft start are very effective for not feeling drowsy in the morning. Even on nights when I get less than 4 hours of sleep I am able to wake up fresh.  If you have any trouble waking up in the morning, try this app!

author: Patryk Szafranski
comment: I subscribe already, also pay for using extra features for up to 5 devices how u saying in desc. Unfortunately it's hidden features. Why u can't makes thinks easy. I understand everything is about money but in this u not make much more but only negative experience your already customers. I can only suggest to change this little option which one is not worth to be reached by more customers. Of course if I see any progress change my ffeedbacj. Otherwise app is so great for me very like.

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Many thanks for your valuable feedback. We are unfortunately unable to react to all of the reviews on Google Play Store. If you encounter any issues with the app, it is best to contact us on our support email: support@urbandroid.org or to give us more details, use menu-report a bug. Many thanks. Jiri from Urbandroid Team.

comment: I love this app. It looks good, it's easy to use, the alarms actually wake me up, and I love being able to track and rate my sleep every night.  The only thing I'd comment on is the sleep deficit. I'd like to be able to set a range of acceptable hours of sleep - that way if I go under *or over* it is noted.

author: Michael Watson
comment: Not very easy to use and many parts don't seem to work at all. For example I've tried to add my "bed time" to my home screen but selecting the box to show the "bed time" doesn't do anything. Also under stats there are a lot of metrics like "Deep Sleep", " Efficiency" and "Rating" but no explanation of what these mean... Not useful but at least it was only $4

author: joshuacomputer
comment: I've used this to get rid of my horrible insomnia... this lack of sleep was slowly killing me. .. this app takes a long time to master and it's always upgrading.. for the better.. I use this.. everyday, now I also use gar min. This has been a hard brutal road.. but also a miracle for me... it works, it's powerful. I'm x us navy  .. that destroys. Your sleep..

author: Jason W
comment: I want the old colors back, quit working so I had to reinstall. Really liked the old version and paid for that. Really liked the and trusted the way it was. After figuring out to turn on tabs its more what im used to. Still bothered that the old version quit working and left me hanging

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: UPDATE: Hello, if you prefer an always dark theme you can set it in settings - misc- theme - night owl, if you do not like the adaptive white during day, dark during night approach. For details please contact support@urbandroid.org or to give us more details, use menu-report a bug. Many thanks. Jiri from Urbandroid Team.

author: Patricio Nicolás Cerón Caballol
comment: I've been late twice this week because my alarm didn't ring, it worked fine on my old phone. Now I have a Huawei Mate 10 Lite. Please check, I really love this app

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Are you seeing high battery use?The app only consumes battery when tracking sleep(moon icon in status bar).Even then it only consumes 1-4% battery / hour of tracking depending on options.But we keep the CPU awake and any use of the CPU by other apps is accounted as our consumpion in battery stats.For details please contact support@urbandroid.org

author: Liam Briggs
comment: I loved this app for years... But the new interface update has made it a pain to use or get to any of the stored sleep times I once had... Until I realized it depended on where you pressed to access each. I had this set to 5 previously... Had to knock it down to 4...

comment: I love it and have been using it for quite a while now. As a new mum I just wish it had a tag for baby sounds to help me see how they are sleeping through the night as I never remember in the morning how many times I woke up

author: Anji Marth
comment: they removed the long term graph chart feature in this latest update; it's the only reason I used this app (and paid for the extras!) so disappointing

author: Ktana Lynn
comment: I loved this app and everything was going well, but I updated it and grabbed some new lullabies. First, many of the lullabies sound like they are being played from a tin can. My phone is new, their speakers are great, and hearing a metal cat purr is not relaxing.  Second, sonar seems to defeat the purpose of recording yourself sleep. If you playback your sleep, all you hear is clicking beeps. Not only that, but it kept raising the volume on my phone! *I* may not mind listening to monks chanting OM into the wee hours, but my spouse sure as hell isn't into it. Clearly I can just go back to the other setting, but I figured someone should be informed about that fun volume issue.

author: Christian Antley
comment: My main problem start with the new type of tracking. Now it seems that it never knows when I'm awake or asleep or when I slept really bad, and it almost always wakes me up as early as possible rather than whenever it should. (Like it my alarm is 6:00-6:30, it wakes me up right at 6). I like the other features, like the alarm that makes sure you are up and such. I just wish sleep tracking worked, or appeared to.

author: Jiří Stejskal
comment: Hi guys.  I am having trouble to enable 30min smart waking.  If I put 25 or 40 it works,  but setting smart to 30min makes me awake the exact time I set the alarm to.  Having Xiaomi redmi note 4. Thx for rply

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Hello,I see you have a Xiaomi device which is problematic.For better performance go to the [Security-Battery-App Battery Saver-Sleep as Android-No restriction],than enable SaA to autostart in the security center.For details please contact support@urbandroid.org

author: Ajinkya Borade
comment: Great app to track your sleeping. My phone even works as a Sonar. The only bad side is UI is bit complicated.

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Many thanks for your valuable feedback.We try to make the app as simple as possible but sleep tracking isn't an easy domain like news reading or emails.Please contact support@urbandroid.org and we are here for you to explain anything you want to know.We have a comprehensive documentation about every aspect of the app here https://goo.gl/l8HgxX

comment: Excessive battery usage on a Pixel 2 with the latest Android stable was NOT caused by this app but by another broken Google system "update". SORRY, Urbandroid Team :(   If others have the same problem with 8.1 and a Pixel 2: Restarting the device every couple of hours fixes battery draining. It's only some system issue.

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Hello, at the moment we do not have this reported for Pixel 2. For details please contact support@urbandroid.org..many thanks..

author: Mehmet Tokmak
comment: I unlocked the App for 4€ and now it says the premium trial expired... the app is good nut I will rate 5 stars if o get my money or the premium back

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Hello, thank you for your feedback. If you have purchased the unlock, but the app does not seem to be unlocked, please see the FAQ here: http://sleep.urbandroid.org/documentation/faq/#qe-faq-1491

author: Adam Duda
comment: Done with this app, have alarm set for everyday except weekends but sometimes it just won't go off. Alarm should be reliable, this one is not.

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Hello, please set the ringtone of the alarm to silent in Settings-Alarm default settings-Ringtone (or tap on any alarm to change the ringtone for jhust that alarm). Auto sleep detection is usually very unreliable (especially without wearable) so we are currently not using it.

comment: This app was great. I liked it so much I paid to unlock it, and used it every day. Then in the most recent update they destroyed the interface, sleep tracking now stops before you wake up, and I've just been woken up by an alarm I had turned off after just 5 hours sleep on a Sunday morning. Hard to see how I can continue using anything as buggy as this, and alpha testing on your paid users leaves a very unpleasant taste in the mouth. Even if they fix these bugs, how can I trust them not to do this again? UPDATE: The developer has tried to dismiss these issues by saying it's a problem with my phone, and that other people all love the new interface. There was no "problem with my phone" until the app was updated, and I've already seen comments from other users saying they don't like it! I've already figured out what happened and exactly why it happened, and it wasn't my phone. Insulting the intelligence of your users isn't a good look. Fix your poorly tested update!!

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: UPDATE: Play Store reviews are not a good place to resolve device specific issue or to report bug, I only have 350 characters to answer, please contact info@urbandroid.org or ideally use menu - report a bug to give us details. Regarding the new look of the app, you can always get back to tabs by using menu - tabs, this will switch the dashboard off

author: Jack Hiron
comment: Great app, just please fix the whole "Eye of the tiger" spotify integration issue. I've never hated the song more than I do because of this app 😅

reply.author: Urbandroid Team
reply.content: Hi,Spotify API sometimes unexpectedly stops reacting to our intent to play a song.We then play a default song Eye of the tiger.The only thing that helps is to close and reopen Spotify, play a song in Spotify, pause it and go to sleep.When playing a Spotify album as a ringtone, this is never needed. See: sleep.urbandroid.org/help/spotify_album.mp4
